info.name: Pumpkin Curse
info.attribution:
Board layout by Shobu. Released to public domain under CC0.

The background image (and library image) were generated by Midjourney using the prompt "halloween dice parade night cartoon minimalist --ar 16:10" and "pumpkin dice halloween, cartoon, funny, movie cover style"

The dice bag is by mousewax and is released to the public domain as CC0.

All other graphics are from https://game-icons.net/ and are used under the CC BY 3.0 license (created by Delapouite):

https://game-icons.net/1x1/delapouite/rolling-dices.html
info.description: In Pumpkin Curse, you are trying to get rid of all your pumpkins through skillful rolling of dice by sending them to their respective pumpkin patches, or to your opponents!
info.ruleText:
Roll dice and set them aside:
To start, roll all the dice you have. Select one face to keep all the dice of. For example, if you rolled 1-1-4-4-single Pumpkin-double Pumpkin, you could save the two 1’s, or the two 4’s, or one of the two pumpkin dice. After saving dice, you have to decide if you want to roll again, or end your turn. If you roll again, you must save a die face that you have not already saved before. So in the example above, if you saved the 4’s, you could not save the 4’s again on later rolls this turn. If you saved single pumpkins on a roll, you are still allowed to save double pumpkins on a later roll.

If the pip value of your saved dice is less than 7, you must roll again, using all of the remaining dice you did not set aside.
 
If the pip value you have saved equals 7 or more, you can choose to stop rolling the dice now and assess if you get to give any of your pumpkins away. First, count the # of pips you have showing.
  • If the value is 7-10, then you check the pumpkin patch that corresponds to your total pip number. Check how many pumpkins are in that patch and compare it to how many pumpkin symbols you saved from your rolls. 
    • If the number of pumpkins in the patch is greater than the number you have saved, then you take as many pumpkins as available from the patch to equal the difference between you and the patch. For example, if you rolled 2 pumpkins but the patch has 3 pumpkins, then you would take 1 pumpkin from the patch. *Note: if you ever were to go over 10 pumpkins, then you simply discard the excess by sending them to pumpkin patch #11+. 
    • If you have more pumpkin symbols rolled than what is in the patch, then you deposit pumpkins from your supply to the patch to equal the difference between you and the patch. If the numbers are equal, you do not give or get any pumpkins. 
  • If you have a pip value of 11+, then you just deposit the # of pumpkins you rolled into the 11+ patch. You do not compare pumpkins when you roll 11+. Pumpkins never come back from the 11+ patch.
  • Finally, if you were able to transfer any pumpkins to any patch, and you also saved any #1 dice faces, then you must transfer a pumpkin from your supply to another player for every die you saved that had a #1 and these can go to different players if you saved multiple #1's.
If you ever roll the dice and you cannot save a die face that has not been saved before, OR if you have rolled all 6 dice and your total is less than 7 pips, then you have busted and failed to break the pumpkin curse. For this failure, you have to choose one pumpkin patch that has the most pumpkins in it, and take all of the pumpkins from that patch into your supply. Remember, any time your supply goes over 10, you place the excess into patch 11+. If multiple patches have the same number of pumpkins, you can choose which one to take from. 

End of the game
The game ends when it is the start of a player's turn and they have no pumpkins remaining. This means that they need to give away all their pumpkins on their turn, and then not receive any pumpkins from anyone else until the start of their next turn. If a player starts their turn with no pumpkins, they are the winner of Pumpkin Curse!
info.helpText: Sit in any seats available (from 2 to 4 players). Take your turn (roll dice, set dice aside the rolling track, and move pumpkin tokens depending on your roll result). Then give the lead to your neighbor by clicking on "Next player". Click "Reset" if you want to setup another game.

fields.text: Are you sure you want to reset the game?

gameStartRoutine: // set random x,y to each dice

millisecondsChangeRoutine.Note: If the button is paused, then do nothing.

elseRoutine.Note: If the timer is not paused, then get all the variables need for the timer to perform its functions.

elseRoutine: // These try to space the dice evenly across the Dice Container

loopRoutine.Note: Die is given a random number of times to land for each roll if not already set.
If the number of remaining rolls is 1 or more, keep rolling.

elseRoutine.Note: If no rolls remain, set the scale back to 1.

elseRoutine: // Extra roll to allow the animations to finish.

elseRoutine.Note: If the number of rolls done is greater than or equal to the max number of rolls of any die, we're done. Do some cleanup.

thenRoutine.Note: If no rolls remain, set the scale back to 1.

clickRoutine.Note: Clicking the button starts the timer.

clickRoutine: // set random x,y to each dice
